column2: ALASKA DMV PERMIT TEST
column4: Alaska

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. Road signs that direct drivers to services are:
column4: brown and white.
column8: blue and white.

column2: 2. This sign means:
column4: The traffic signal is not operational
column8: Open intersection ahead

column2: 3. This sign means:
column4: The driver is near a school and should watch for children.
column8: Business area nearby. Watch for business people.
column10: There is a work zone ahead. Watch for workers.

column2: 4. While inside the roundabout, you should:
column4: change lanes before you check for vehicles behind you.
column6: remain in your lane until you are ready to exit.
column8: use your left turn signal if you are in position to exit now.

column2: 5. This signal means:
column4: Stop
column8: Slow down

column2: 6. If an aggressive driver is behind you:
column4: sound your horn and move to the left lane.
column6: slow down and confront the aggressive driver.
column8: try to get out of the aggressive driver’s way.
column10: increase you speed and flash your brake lights.

column2: 7. If another vehicle is approaching you head-on in your lane, you should _______, sound your horn and brake.
column4: steer right
column6: None of the other answers is correct.
column8: steer left
column10: stay in the center of your lane

column2: 8. In heavy rain, tires can begin to ride on the water that is on top of the road pavement. This is called:
column4: rideplaning.
column8: pavement-planing.

column2: 9. You are driving and you are feeling drowsy. You should:
column4: find a safe place to stop for a break.
column8: turn on the radio to keep you awake.
column10: have a beer or two to keep you awake.

column2: 10. ________ is the only effective way to reduce your Blood Alcohol Content (BAC).
column4: Time
column8: Taking a cold shower

column2: 11. If you begin to feel drowsy while driving, you should:
column4: open your window.
column8: get an energy drink.

column2: 12. If you are blinded by headlights on an approaching vehicle, you should:
column4: flash your headlights to high beam for a second, then return to low beam.
column6: use the road edge as a guide until the approaching vehicle passes by.
column8: move your eyes to the right.

column2: 13. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: there is a double curve ahead.
column8: there is a winding road ahead.
column10: they must turn either to the right or left.

column2: 14. The yield sign means:
column4: You must come to a complete stop.
column6: The traffic light will soon be red.
column8: Slow down and give vehicles crossing your path the right-of-way.
column10: Drive with caution in wet weather.

column2: 15. When you approach a railroad crossing, but you do not see a train. You must stop:
column4: if a stop sign is posted.
column6: if the crossing lights are flashing.
column8: if a crossing gate is lowered.

column2: 16. A broken white line:
column4: separates two lanes traveling in the same direction.
column6: marks the right edge of the roadway.
column8: means passing or crossing is prohibited in that lane.

column2: 17. To avoid a rear-end collision with the car in front of you, you should:
column4: use the four-second rule.
column8: watch for brake lights.

column2: 18. Drinking alcohol while taking drugs:
column4: reduces the effects of the alcohol.
column6: reduces the effects of the drug or medicine.
column8: has no effect, they are different substances.
column10: could multiply the effects of the alcohol.

column2: 19. What should you do if your rear wheels start to skid?
column4: Turn the steering wheel in the direction the vehicle is trying to go.
column6: Take your foot off the gas and shift to neutral.
column8: If the vehicle has ABS, pump the pedal carefully.
column10: Steer left if your rear wheels slide right.

column2: 20. If another car is in danger of hitting you, you should:
column4: flash your brake lights.
column8: use your emergency lights.
